title: [ppc64le] add -fexceptions to aten build function for C and CXX builds
body_html:
In recent clone of pytorch from master, and running test_torch.py , the test fails on ppc64le with : test_apply (test_torch.TestTorch) ... terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::runtime_error'
what(): given function should return a number at /home/freddie/projects/pull_request/pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/TensorMethods.cpp:8206
Aborted (core dumped)

This is failing on an ATen library. The library is currently built without the -fexceptions flags. Adding the flag in build_aten() inside build_libs.sh
body_text:

Aborted (core dumped)
This is failing on an ATen library.  The library is currently built without the -fexceptions flags.  Adding the flag in build_aten() inside build_libs.sh
body:
In recent clone of pytorch from master,  and running test_torch.py , the test fails on ppc64le with : test_apply (test_torch.TestTorch) ... terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::runtime_error'
  what():  given function should return a number at /home/freddie/projects/pull_request/pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/TensorMethods.cpp:8206
Aborted (core dumped)

This is failing on an ATen library.  The library is currently built without the -fexceptions flags.  Adding the flag in build_aten() inside build_libs.sh
